intro: Connarus williamsii var. williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as an understory shrub, adapting to low light conditions in dense forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical biodiversity.
